definition: to arouse/to evoke/to cause/to stir up

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: This announcement will arouse a feeling of anger among freedom-loving people.
sentences.chinese: 這一宣告將會激起愛好自由人們的憤怒。

sentences.english: There is nothing like a long walk to arouse the appetite.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼比走很長的路更能激起食慾的了。

sentences.english: Niki's voice provoked a new bout of unreasoning anger.
sentences.chinese: 妮基一開口又激起了無名的怒火。

sentences.english: His extreme practices aroused the alarm and horror of European bloodletting physicians .
sentences.chinese: 他的極端行爲激起了歐洲放血醫師的警覺和恐慌。

sentences.english: The job attributed to basophils that has spurred the most discussion is presenting antigens.
sentences.chinese: 嗜鹼性細胞抗原呈遞的新功能激起了最爲熱烈的討論。

sentences.english: Don't stir up area discrimination, or it'll trigger many disharmonious sounds.
sentences.chinese: 不要搞出地域歧視來，否則會激起很多不和諧的聲音。

sentences.english: The strong gusts whipped up eddies of fallen leaves.
sentences.chinese: 強勁的陣風激起了落葉漩渦。

sentences.english: He has never expected a touch to be so mysteriously arousing.
sentences.chinese: 他從沒料到一個觸碰能這般神祕地激起內心的激情。

sentences.english: The intruders' tyrannical behavior led the local people to revolt.
sentences.chinese: 略者的殘虐的行徑，激起了當地民衆的反抗。

sentences.english: Rwanda's support for the CNDP is fuelling much of the violence.
sentences.chinese: 盧旺達對CNDP的支持已經激起許多暴動。

sentences.english: It does not help asking the question once your anger has been aroused.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你的憤怒被激起，問你什麼問題都是白費力氣。

sentences.english: His polished oration piqued the audiences's interest.
sentences.chinese: 他精彩的演講激起了觀衆的興趣。

sentences.english: The strange round-shaped object stimulate the curiosity of chidren.
sentences.chinese: 這奇怪的圓形物體激起了孩子們的好奇心。

sentences.english: The water droplets are being sent into the air by the vibration of a male alligator's sub-sonic call.
sentences.chinese: 一隻雄短吻鱷魚哼叫時發出的亞音波激起片片水花。

definition: to lift/to raise in height/to begin/upsurge/to set off (a campaign)
billows/great waves (fig. of a story with great momentum)
spray/ocean spray/spindrift/fig. happenings from one's life/CL:朵[duo3]
to well up/to boil out/to bubble forth/to spurt
to settle (a dispute)/to quieten down/to suppress
to lead to/to trigger/to initiate/to cause/to evoke (emotions)
to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes, controversy, flames of revolution)
to spring up everywhere/from all around
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to submerge/to drown/to flood/to drown out (also fig.)
